smell_analysis.justification: No empty diagrams were found; all pages contain visual model elements.

All use cases are associated with actors. The use case 'Vaata kõiki ootel või mitteaktiivseid autosid' is included by 'Aktiveeri auto' and 'Muuda auto mitteaktiivseks', which are connected to the 'Autode haldur' actor, establishing a valid indirect association.
No redundant use case names were found. 'Lõpeta auto' (Terminate) and 'Unusta auto' (Forget) represent distinct lifecycle events, as confirmed by the state diagram.
No packages contain multiple elements with the same name.
The database schema is normalized. Shared attributes like 'nimetus' appear in distinct entities (e.g., 'Auto' vs 'Auto_mark') representing different data, and appropriate foreign keys are used.
Use case naming is consistent, using the Verb-Noun form (e.g., 'Registreeri auto', 'Vaata kõiki autosid').
All states in the 'Auto seisundidiagramm' (Page 9) are reachable via transitions starting from the 'Algus' node.
All actions in the 'Auto lõpetamise tegevusdiagramm' (Page 4) are reachable via the control flow.
All visible associations on class diagrams include multiplicity indicators (e.g., 1, 0..*) at both ends.
No diagram exceeds the limit of 10 central elements. The most populated diagram (Page 15) contains 9 tables.
No class or table has 6 or more connection lines. The most connected class, 'Isik' on Page 6, has exactly 5 connection lines (3 associations and 2 inheritances).
The layout of elements is uniform with no excessive distances between related elements.
All use cases and activity actions start with active verbs (e.g., 'Vaata', 'Otsi', 'Lõpeta').
No names of 3 characters or less were found. Shortest class names like 'Riik', 'Isik', and 'Auto' are 4 characters long.
All class names are capitalized and singular (e.g., 'Isik', 'Auto', 'Klient').
All attribute and column names start with a lowercase letter (e.g., 'e_meil', 'on_aktiivne').
No element names use type prefixes (e.g., no 'tbl_', 'str', or 'uc_').
